title: TimothÃ©e Chalamet Says Netflix Wants the â€˜Biggest Action Set Pieces Up Frontâ€™ as Matthew McConaughey Mourns the Loss of Act One in Movies: â€˜The First Thing That Gets Cutâ€™
description: In bonus footage from â€œA CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaughey,â€ the two actors discussed how studios have begun
body:
In bonus footage from â€œA CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaughey,â€ the two actors discussed how studios have begun catering to people who are using their phones while watching movies or TV shows. 

	â€œIn this day of shorter attention spans and vertical 12-second spots, are we losing the patience for Act 1?â€ McConaughey said. â€œBecause itâ€™s the first thing that gets cut. Itâ€™s the first thing a studio wants to get rid of. Iâ€™m seeing Act 2, more and more, start on freakinâ€™ page 12 [of a script]. Iâ€™m seeing 10-part series where â€” bam! â€” Act 1â€™s over 32 minutes into the opening episode, and youâ€™re off on the conflict right away. It feels abbreviated to me.â€
	

	Chalamet responded, â€œI saw an article about a Netflix production guideline â€” not for all movies, I donâ€™t want to speak disparagingly, but â€” where they want their biggest action set pieces up front. The logic used to be: Save your big action set piece for the end of a movie. You save the fireworks for the end. But now they want something up front.â€


	Chalamet was referencing Matt Damon and Ben Affleckâ€™s recent interview with Joe Rogan about their Netflix movie â€œThe Rip,â€ where Damon revealed the streamerâ€™s strategy for making action movies. â€œThe standard way to make an action movie that we learned was, you usually have three set pieces. One in the first act, one in the second, one in the third,â€ Damon said. â€œYou spend most of your money on that one in the third act. Thatâ€™s your finale. And now theyâ€™re like, â€˜Can we get a big one in the first five minutes? We want people to stay. And it wouldnâ€™t be terrible if you reiterated the plot three or four times in the dialogue because people are on their phones while theyâ€™re watching.â€™â€
	

	But Chalamet hasnâ€™t lost hope. â€œI also think thereâ€™s sort of a reverse thing going on where people are desiring things that are more patient and that pull you in,â€ he said. â€œI just saw another article that says Gen Z is a bigger moviegoing audience than millennials. â€˜Frankensteinâ€™ was a hugely popular movie this year; I didnâ€™t think that pacing was extraordinarily fast, but it pulled people in.â€

	â€œSome people want to be entertained quickly,â€ Chalamet continued. â€œIâ€™m really right in the middle, because I admire people [saying], â€˜Hey, we gotta keep movie theaters alive. We gotta keep this genre alive.â€™ And another part of me feels like, if people want to see it â€” like â€œBarbie,â€ like â€œOppenheimerâ€ â€” theyâ€™re going to go see it and go out of their way to be loud and proud about it.â€

	With a laugh, he concluded: â€œI donâ€™t want to be working in ballet or opera where itâ€™s like, â€˜Hey, keep this thing alive, even though no one cares about this anymoreâ€™ â€”Â all respect to the ballet and opera people out there.â€

	Watch the extended version of â€œA CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaugheyâ€ on Varietyâ€˜s YouTube channel or on the CNN app.

schema.headline: TimothÃ©e Chalamet Says Netflix Wants the â€˜Biggest Action Set Pieces Up Frontâ€™ as Matthew McConaughey Mourns the Loss of Act One in Movies: â€˜The First Thing That Gets Cutâ€™

title: Busy Philipps Joins CBS Legal Drama â€˜Cupertinoâ€™
description:
Busy Philipps has joined the upcoming CBS drama series â€œCupertinoâ€ in a series regular role, Variety has learned. 

	Philipps joins the show alongsi
body:
Busy Philipps has joined the upcoming CBS drama series â€œCupertinoâ€ in a series regular role, Variety has learned. 

	Philipps joins the show alongside fellow cast members Mike Colter, Rachel Keller, Renee Elise Goldsberry, Ella Stiller, and Nik Dodani. The logline states that the show is â€œa David vs. Goliath legal drama set in the heart of Silicon Valley that follows a lawyer (Colter) who is being cheated out of his stock-options by his former employer, a tech start-up. Refusing to back down, he joins forces with another recently fired attorney (Keller) to represent those taken advantage of by the tech elite, and help them fight back in a high-stakes battle against the Goliaths controlling Silicon Valley.â€
	

	Philipps will star as Natalia, who is described as â€œthe beautiful and delightfully blunt first wife of an AI Billionaire, who divorced her when she turned forty. Now Natalia wants revenge and agrees to finance Michael and Oliviaâ€™s start-up law firm in order to go after his and other AI businesses.â€


	Philipps broke out early in her career with roles in iconic shows like â€œFreaks and Geeksâ€ and â€œDawsonâ€™s Creek.â€ She has also starred in shows like â€œCougar Town,â€ which ran for six seasons, and the critically-acclaimed comedy â€œGirls5Eva.â€ Her film credits include â€œMean Girls: The Musical,â€ â€œI Feel Pretty,â€ and â€œThe Gift.â€ She currently hosts the QVC+ talk show â€œBusy This Weekâ€ and previously hosted the E! talk show â€œBusy Tonight.â€ 

	She is repped by Range Media Partners and Gang Tyre. 

	â€œCupertinoâ€ hails from Robert and Michelle King, who will write, executive produce, and co-showrun the series under their King Size Productions banner. Robert will also direct the pilot, with Liz Glotzer also executive producing. The Kings are executive producing under their overall deal with CBS Studios. 
	

	â€œCupertinoâ€ was formally picked up to series at CBS in October 2025. The Kings originally set the show up for development at CBS in 2024, with the network then commissioning a full writers room and a 13-episode script order in 2025.

schema.headline: Busy Philipps Joins CBS Legal Drama â€˜Cupertinoâ€™

title: LISTEN: Showrunner Bill Lawrence on the Relaunch of â€˜Scrubsâ€™ and Rise of â€˜Roosterâ€™
description: On todayâ€™s episode of â€œDaily Varietyâ€ podcast, Varietyâ€™s Michael Schneider speaks to â€œTed Lassoâ€ and â€œShrinkingâ€ exec producer Bill Lawrence on the
body:
On todayâ€™s episode of â€œDaily Varietyâ€ podcast, Varietyâ€™s Michael Schneider speaks to â€œTed Lassoâ€ and â€œShrinkingâ€ exec producer Bill Lawrence on the relaunch of â€œScrubsâ€ on ABC and Hulu. Lawrence explains how heâ€™s busier than ever in his career â€” after surviving â€œa couple of five- and eight-year gaps when I couldnâ€™t get anything going on TV.â€Â 

	More to come

			
			Popular on Variety		
	

	Listen to Daily VarietyÂ onÂ iHeartPodcasts,Â Apple Podcasts, Varietyâ€™sÂ YouTube PodcastÂ channel,Â Amazon Music,Â SpotifyÂ and other podcast platforms.

title: Watch â€˜A CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaugheyâ€™ With Bonus Footage
description: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaughey came together for a one-of-a-kind town hall conversation hosted by Variety and CNN. The program, which air
body:
TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaughey came together for a one-of-a-kind town hall conversation hosted by Variety and CNN. The program, which aired Feb. 21 on CNN, is now available to stream on Varietyâ€˜s YouTube channel, along with bonus footage. 

	â€œA CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaughey,â€ which was filmed before a live audience of University of Texas at Austinâ€™s students, marked a reunion for Chalamet and McConaughey, who played son and father in Christopher Nolanâ€™s 2014 sci-fi epic â€œInterstellar.â€ 
	

	In the 90-minute conversation, the actors discussed their memories from â€œInterstellar,â€ Chalametâ€™s role in â€œMarty Supreme,â€ their approaches to acting and more. Chalamet and McConaughey also answered questions from audience members throughout the evening. 


	â€œMan, thatâ€™s remains my favorite project Iâ€™ve ever been in,â€ Chalamet told McConaughey about â€œInterstellar.â€ â€œI think itâ€™s your most fantastic role. I know you were coming off â€˜Dallas Buyers Club,â€™ but that movie, to me, was the origin point in seeing how you carried yourself on set, how seriously you and Christopher Nolan took the work. It gave me a license. Coming out of high school, itâ€™s hard to take yourself super seriously. You can feel like youâ€™re wasting time or stuck-up or something. And I remember you had a yoga mat, and youâ€™d be working out and sleeping on set. It was all very strange to me. But it was super inspiring. I just canâ€™t thank you enough for being warm to me at that time, when you had no reason to be warm to me. Christopher as well. It just changed my life, man.â€
	

	McConaughey responded, â€œThanks for that, man. You were pretty easy to be warm to. I remember you had what I felt like was a feverish curiosity at that time. You were figuring some stuff out, but it seemed obvious to me that no matter what you were dealing with, you were going to make your way. And I believe you were in some sort of limbo. You were choosing â€” something about music, and somebody was putting pressure about, â€˜Maybe go this way,â€™ and you wanted to goÂ thisÂ way.â€

	At one point, Chalamet shared new details about â€œDune: Part Three,â€ which opens in theaters this December. He teased that the final film in Denis Villeneuveâ€™s sci-fi trilogy is the â€œeeriest oneâ€ and a â€œbig swing.â€ 

	Chalamet later added, â€œI didnâ€™t want to be complacent about a single moment. Everything was sacred, and it was my last time doing a â€˜Duneâ€™ film, so I really wanted to treat it as sacred. Because people can get complacent, but I was more intense on the third one. It felt like that was the natural momentum, so I wanted to push against that as hard as I could.â€

	Watch â€œA CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaugheyâ€ below.

schema.headline: Watch â€˜A CNN & Variety Town Hall Event: TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Matthew McConaugheyâ€™ With Bonus Footage

title: â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Artists on How They Made Gary Deâ€™Snake Empathetic by Softening His Eyes and Adding a Brow
description: â€œZootopia 2â€ introduces Gary Deâ€™Snake (voiced by Ke Huy Quan), a reptile whose home and community are destroyed by the evil machinations of the lynx
body:
â€œZootopia 2â€ introduces Gary Deâ€™Snake (voiced by Ke Huy Quan), a reptile whose home and community are destroyed by the evil machinations of the lynx family. His heroic actions â€” along with those of returning protagonists Judy Hopps (Ginnifer Goodwin) and Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman) â€”ultimately foil the villains.

	But how do you make a pit viper empathetic? 

	Production designer Cory Loftis explains that Garyâ€™s design evolved from being intentionally ambiguous â€” do we trust him? â€” to feeling instantly sympathetic. Initially, Garyâ€™s eyes were placed more on the sides of his head. â€œBut very quickly, the story started to evolve where itâ€™s like, we want you to love this guy right out of the gate.
	

	So we rotated his eyes to the front of his head so he could look right at you, and you could empathize with him straight away. We rounded his eyes out. We decided not to lose all of the reptileness, so we kept the long vertical pupils, but theyâ€™re softened a bit.â€


	Snakes donâ€™t have eyelids, so Garyâ€™s eyes protrude from the top of his head â€œmore like a frog than a snake,â€ Loftis says. â€œSo itâ€™s not pure snake anatomy, but we built this thick brow over the top that he could push down onto his eyes to make lid-type shapes.â€

	As for the village where the snakes once lived, art director Sang Jun Lee proposed that the houses be interconnected to convey a strong, close-knit community. This made their destruction â€” and the communityâ€™s separation â€” feel all the more devastating. Scale motifs appear throughout both exteriors and interiors. â€œWe made sure the counter heights were all low, because they would sort of slither up to them,â€ Loftis notes. The tables are curved, with natural scoops for snakes to settle into.
	

	â€œWe also ensured that all the handles on doors and cabinets could be wrapped by a snakeâ€™s tail, with pull handles on almost everything,â€ he says.

	â€œAnd we really tried to think about where they would sit. Chairs didnâ€™t seem particularly useful, so there are lots of cushions and poufs for them to curl up on.â€ Loftis adds that some story artists contributed clever ideas as well, including ensuring that every area had a snake accessible ramp so characters could slide up without bumping over stairs.

	â€œThere are slides everywhere so they can move around,â€ he says. â€œI have a very inventive art team. They really went to town on the mission and came up with some great ideas.



	

					WALT DISNEY ANIMATION STUDIOS â€“ Zootopia 2 visual development artwork by Mac George III Â© Disney

schema.headline: â€˜Zootopia 2â€™ Artists on How They Made Gary Deâ€™Snake Empathetic by Softening His Eyes and Adding a Brow

title: â€˜Joe vs. Caroleâ€™ Creator Etan Frankel Signs First-Look Producing Deal With Fox Entertainment
description:
â€œJoe vs. Caroleâ€ creator Etan Frankel has signed a first-look producing deal with Fox Entertainment Studios. 

	Under the pact, Frankel â€” whose cred
body:
â€œJoe vs. Caroleâ€ creator Etan Frankel has signed a first-look producing deal with Fox Entertainment Studios. 

	Under the pact, Frankel â€” whose credits include â€œShamelessâ€ and â€œFriday Night Lightsâ€ â€” will develop and produce scripted series across genres. Per a press release, heâ€™ll work closely with Fox leadership to â€œdevelop a strategic slate of scripted projects aligned with the studioâ€™s creative priorities, including premium drama, elevated genre storytelling, and distinctive, creator-driven series with global appeal.â€
	

	â€œEtan is an exceptional storyteller with a rare ability to blend emotional depth, sharp perspective, and commercial appeal,â€ saidÂ Hannah Pillemer, head of scripted at Fox Entertainment Studios. â€œHe has built an impressive body of work across platforms and genres, and his voice, taste, and leadership make him an ideal partner as we continue to expand our premium scripted slate.â€


	Frankel added, â€œIâ€™m excited to be partnering with Fox Entertainment Studios at a moment when the studio is clearly investing in bold, creator-led storytelling. Hannah and her team have built an environment that champions ambition, collaboration, and originality, and Iâ€™m thrilled to develop meaningful, resonant series together.â€

	Frankel is currently developing the Millie Bobby Brown vehicle â€œPrismâ€ for Netflix, on which he will serve as showrunner and executive producer. Under a previous overall deal at Universal Content Productions, Frankel created the scripted, â€œTiger Kingâ€-related Peacock miniseries â€œJoe vs. Carole,â€ which starred Kate McKinnon as Big Cat Rescue founder Carole Baskin and John Cameron Mitchell as Joe Exotic.
	

	Before that, Frankel was the showrunner and executive producer on â€œSorry for Your Lossâ€ and an EP on â€œGet Shorty,â€Â â€œAnimal Kingdomâ€ andÂ â€œShameless,â€ on which he wrote for seven seasons.Â 

	Frankel is represented byÂ CAA, Literate and Gendler Kelly.

schema.headline: â€˜Joe vs. Caroleâ€™ Creator Etan Frankel Signs First-Look Producing Deal With Fox Entertainment

title: â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Cinematographer Darius Khondji Used Haze Machines to Create a 1950s New York Look
description: In â€œMarty Supreme,â€ TimothÃ©e Chalamet plays the titular character, an underdog who is convinced that table tennis is his ticket to success. Set in 1
body:
In â€œMarty Supreme,â€ TimothÃ©e Chalamet plays the titular character, an underdog who is convinced that table tennis is his ticket to success. Set in 1952, Marty is a hustler working at a shoe store, where he pretends customersâ€™ sizes are out of stock to upsell them on pricier pairs. On the side, heâ€™s always looking for his next get-rich-quick scheme.



	

									Atsushi Nishijima
	



	Director Josh Safdie and Oscar-nominated cinematographer Darius Khondji brought the frenetic world of â€œMarty Supremeâ€ to life. Khondji let Safdieâ€™s script, which was co-written with Ronald Bronstein, guide him. No stranger to shooting period films, Khondji, who is nominated for an ASC award and an Academy Award for his work on the film, worked closely with production designer Jack Fisk, and was inspired by the photography of the era, particularly that of Helen Levitt.
	

	â€œMost of the conversation was that the greediness of New York was a big thing for us, that we wanted New York to look like it could have been at the time, in the â€™50s, so I put haze in the streets [for] pollution. There is always a layer between the actor, and we photograph through these layers,â€ Khondji says.


	Gwyneth Paltrow plays faded movie star Kay Stone, whoâ€™s wooed by Martyâ€™s hustling ways. Thetwo first cross paths at the Ritz Hotel in London in a scene where Marty watches her regally enter the dining room as Khondjiâ€™s camera follows, gliding along with her. Shortly after, Marty calls her room.Khondji credits Safdieâ€™s vision and ideas when it came to framing. â€œHeâ€™s the one coming up with this very modern, exciting idea that Gwyneth was going to be in a room, Timmy was going to be in a different room talking to each other, and shoot it at the same time, live.â€
	

	Towards the end, Kay sees through Martyâ€™s ways and has a frank conversation with him about his â€œdreams.â€ Khondji relied on a 360mm anamorphic Cinemascope lens to shoot not just that, but most of the film. Distance was important, and the 360mm lens could provide that. 

	â€œEverything we shot was very observed. You wanted to observe them from a distance.â€ He filmed at the actorâ€™s height to emphasize that. â€œWeâ€™re observing them, whether weâ€™re behind or in the front, weâ€™re really on their face,â€ he says.

schema.headline: â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ Cinematographer Darius Khondji Used Haze Machines to Create a 1950s New York Look

title: UTA Signs â€˜Lord of the Fliesâ€™ and HBOâ€™s â€˜Harry Potterâ€™ Star Lox Pratt (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
UTA has added British actor Lox Pratt to its roster, representing him across all areas.

	Pratt recently gained attention for his role as Jack Merri
body:
UTA has added British actor Lox Pratt to its roster, representing him across all areas.

	Pratt recently gained attention for his role as Jack Merridew in Jack Thorneâ€™s four-part television series â€œLord of the Flies,â€ the first-ever television adaptation of William Goldingâ€™s classic novel. The series follows a group of boys stranded on a deserted island whose attempts at self-governance quickly descend into conflict and disorder. Pratt plays Jack, the ambitious and unpredictable figure whose decisions drive much of the storyâ€™s tension. His performance has been noted for its range, focus and the maturity he brings to the role.
	

	â€œLord of the Fliesâ€ premiered in February on BBC One in the U.K. and Stan in Australia, earning critical recognition for its performances and production. A U.S. release on Netflix is scheduled for later this year.


	Pratt has continued to star in leading roles in major literary adaptations. He is currently filming HBOâ€™s television adaptation of â€œHarry Potter,â€ where he plays Draco Malfoy, the cunning Slytherin student and central antagonist to Harry Potter at Hogwarts, a role originally portrayed by Tom Felton in the film series. He stars alongside Johnny Flynn as Lucius Malfoy. The series is expected to premiere in early 2027.

	Besides UTA, Pratt continues to be represented by Insight Management & Production, Public Eye Communications and Gang, Tyre, Ramer.

	UTA represents a wide range of actors, filmmakers and content creators across film, television and digital media. Pratt joins a roster that includes both established and emerging talent, expanding the agencyâ€™s presence in global television and film.

schema.headline: UTA Signs â€˜Lord of the Fliesâ€™ and HBOâ€™s â€˜Harry Potterâ€™ Star Lox Pratt (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Beta Film Boards Premium Drama Series on the Fairytale King â€˜Ludwigâ€™
description: Beta Film has boarded as international distributor on a crime series about the death of King Ludwig II of Bavaria, whose Castle Neuschwanstein inspi
body:
Beta Film has boarded as international distributor on a crime series about the death of King Ludwig II of Bavaria, whose Castle Neuschwanstein inspired Disneyâ€™s iconic castle logo.

	The show is being produced by W&B Television, best known for â€œPagan Peak,â€ â€œDarkâ€ and â€œ4 Blocks,â€ for German broadcaster ARD.

	The series follows psychologist Gustav Zimmermann who is tasked with reviewing a psychiatric report on King Ludwig II, a document that will ultimately determine whether the king is declared incompetent to rule. The more he invests in discovering the reasons that led to Ludwigâ€™s removal from power, the closer he gets to revealing the secrets of the king: his struggles with power, his longing for freedom and his forbidden love.
	

	Beta Film said: â€ â€˜Ludwigâ€™ is a cinematic journey into the kingâ€™s fantastical world, rich with pomp and gold. Yet behind all the splendor and spectacle stood a deeply enigmatic man â€” as mysterious in life as he was in death. Set in the late 1800s in Bavaria, â€˜Ludwigâ€™ is a fascinating and tragic tale of life and queer love, infused with a captivating crime story at its heart.â€


	Filming took place at historical locations, including Castle Neuschwanstein, one of the worldâ€™s most recognizable landmarks, and the former royal palace in the heart of Munich, the Residenz. Filming also took place in the Czech Republic.

	Up-and-coming talent Luis Pintsch (â€œ22 Lengthsâ€) stars as King Ludwig II, alongside Felix Mayr (â€œUnorthodox,â€ â€œSennaâ€), who plays psychologist Gustav Zimmermann, Aaron Friesz (â€œCorsage,â€ â€œFranz K.â€), Carlotta BÃ¤hre (â€œKuâ€™damm 77â€), Jonathan Kriener (â€œChabosâ€), as well as Tom Wlaschiha (â€œStranger Things,â€ â€œThe Boatâ€), Francis Fulton-Smith (â€œEmpire Oktoberfestâ€), and Karl Markovics (â€œThe Counterfeiters,â€ â€œBabylon Berlinâ€).
	

	â€œLudwigâ€ is directed by Nina Vukovic (â€œKleo 2â€) and Sebastian Ko (â€œTatortâ€), both also serve as writers. Head writers are Dominik Kempf and Marianne Wendt. Jan Prahl (â€œThe Signalâ€) is the director of photography. Oliver Vogel, Quirin Berg, Max Wiedemann and Dominik Kempf serve as executive producers, Stefan MÃ¼therich as co-executive producer, and Gretha Heisig as associate producer.

	Ferdinand Dohna, head of content, Beta Film, said Ludwig was â€œa romantic dreamer with rock-star allure, who accepted no compromises when the realization of his visions and dreams was at stake, most notably Neuschwanstein Castle, which famously inspired Disneyâ€™s iconic castle logo. Like every good romantic hero, he failed in the end and died under mysterious circumstances at a young age. These are the ingredients for larger-than-life characters, brought to life in this miniseries by an outstanding creative team and magnetic cast that will resonate with audiences around the world.â€

	Oliver Vogel, managing director at W&B Television, said: â€œWe all know Ludwig II as a fascinating artistic figure â€“ melancholic, extravagant, withdrawn into a fantasy world far from reality. With â€˜Ludwig,â€™ we are unravelling the old myths, approaching the person behind all these masks, and telling a visually powerful story about a queer life in a repressive era. Together with ARD, BR, Servus TV and SRF, we are bringing the real Ludwig back into the spotlight â€“ vulnerable, contradictory, visionary.â€

	Christoph Pellander, head of commissioning editors at ARD Degeto Film, said: â€œWe are reimagining the tale of the legendary fairytale king as a fictional cold case that is reopened, shedding new light on his mysterious death. Thanks to the outstanding creative team in the writersâ€™ room, directors Nina Vukovic and Sebastian Ko, and executive producers Oliver Vogel and Quirin Berg, this project combines history with modern suspense. Creating a high-end series that meets international standards is only possible by joining forces with great partners. Iâ€™m delighted to partner with Beta Film, BR, as well as ServusTV and SRF, on this exceptional series.â€

	Ludwig is produced by W&B Television for ARD Degeto, BR, ServusTV and SRF. The series is supported by the German Motion Picture Fund (GMPF), the Bavarian Film and Television Fund (FFF Bayern), with the support from the Czech Audiovisual Fundâ€™s Production Incentive. Beta Film handles international sales.

schema.headline: Beta Film Boards Premium Drama Series on the Fairytale King â€˜Ludwigâ€™

title: Oscar-Nominated Documentary â€˜The Perfect Neighborâ€™ to Hold Special Screenings at Stanford, Fordham Law Schools (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Oscar-nominated documentary, â€œThe Perfect Neighbor,â€ will hold special screenings at Stanford University on Feb. 25 and Fordham University School of
body:
Oscar-nominated documentary, â€œThe Perfect Neighbor,â€ will hold special screenings at Stanford University on Feb. 25 and Fordham University School of Law on March 4.

	Directed by Geeta Gandbhir, â€œThe Perfect Neighborâ€ tells the story of a minor neighborhood dispute in Florida that escalated into deadly gun violence when Ajike Owens, a young Black mother of four, was shot and killed by her neighbor, Susan Lorincz. The documentary is made from police bodycam, ringcam, and cell phone footage, as well as recorded 911 calls.
	

	The film highlights Floridaâ€™s Stand Your Ground laws, which allow individuals to use deadly force if they believe it necessary to prevent death or bodily harm, as invoked by Lorincz during her trial.


	Stanford Law School will hold a screening and discussion with Gandbhir and producer Nikon Kwantu on Feb. 25 at 5 p.m. The event will be held in collaboration with the American Constitution Society, the Stanford Criminal Justice Center, Women of Stanford Law, and the Middle Eastern and South Asian Law Students Association.

	Fordham Law Schoolâ€™s Center on Race, Law and Justice will hold a screening and Q&A with Gandbhir and producer Alisa Payne on March 4 at 5:30 p.m.

	Leading up to the 2023 shooting, Lorincz called 911 consistently over a two-year period, complaining that Owensâ€™ children and other neighborhood children were making too much noise and playing on â€œher property.â€ In an interview with Variety, Gandbhir described the pace of the film as â€œa slow burn.â€

	â€œYou have these revelations that make you deeply uncomfortable throughout,â€ said the filmmaker. â€œItâ€™s a horror film in many ways.â€
	

	Originally premiering at the Sundance Film Festival, â€œThe Perfect Neighborâ€ was acquired by Netflix in February 2025 for a reported $5 million. The documentary debuted with 16.7 million views in its first three days on Netflix.

schema.headline: Oscar-Nominated Documentary â€˜The Perfect Neighborâ€™ to Hold Special Screenings at Stanford, Fordham Law Schools (EXCLUSIVE)

title: 'RHOA' Kenya Moore's Hair Spa Ordered to Pay 5 Figures to Landlord in Rent Battle
description:
'RHOA' Alum Kenya Moore
                          Hair Spa Owes Landlord $87K!!!
body:
'RHOA' Alum Kenya Moore
                          Hair Spa Owes Landlord $87K!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            10:55 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          'Real Housewives of Atlanta' star Kenya Mooreâ€™s hair salon was ordered to pay more than $80,000 in a battle over unpaid rent and utilities ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          According to court docs, obtained by TMZ, a Georgia judge ordered the reality starâ€™s company, Moore Vision Media, to pay $43,988 by late February ... and another $43,988.67 by late March -- for a total of $87,976.
      
    
          The judge also ordered Kenyaâ€™s company to pay around $5,500 a month in rent ... until or unless she ends up vacating.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          A couple of weeks after the judge made the decision, the landlord claimed Kenyaâ€™s company failed to pay the first installment by the courtâ€™s deadline and demanded possession of the property immediately. The court has yet to rule on the request.
      

        Waiting for your permission to load the Instagram Media.
      
    
          Kenya opened the Kenya Moore Hair Spa in Atlanta in 2024. The landlord of the location, Northland Chamblee LLC, sued the 'RHOA' star in October 2025, alleging unpaid rent and utilities under the lease.
      
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          The landlord alleged the hair spa ceased paying rent on the property in December 2024.
      
    
          Kenyaâ€™s company denied the allegations. The reality starâ€™s business argued the landlord failed to make improvements to the property, as requested.

title: Martin Short's Daughter Katherine Died By Suicide
body:
Katherine Short
                          Dead at 42
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            11:58 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
          Martin Short's daughter, Katherine, has taken her own life ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          The 42-year-old died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound ... law enforcement sources tell TMZ.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          LAPD and the fire department responded to her Hollywood Hills home Monday, shortly after 6:40 PM PT, where she was found deceased.
      

          Katherine -- the daughter of Short and Nancy Dolman, his wife of 30 years who passed away in 2010 -- worked as a social worker in Los Angeles after receiving her bachelor's degree from NYU and her master's in social work from USC several years later.
      
    
          Katherine was involved in a charity called Bring Change 2 Mind, which worked to break down stigmas connected to mental health issues.
      
    
          While her father is obviously very famous, Katherine mostly stayed out of the public eye ... attending a few events with her father throughout the years. She is the eldest of Short's three children.
      
    
      
        
                    
                      JANUARY 2020
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          We last saw Katherine in January 2020 outside Craig's ... a world-famous restaurant in West Hollywood.
      
    
          This is the second personal tragedy Short has felt in the last few weeks ... having recently paid tribute to his longtime friend Catherine O'Hara after she passed away last month.
      
    
          Short has a sold-out show with Steve Martin scheduled for Saturday in Minneapolis. A spokesperson for the theater told us it's unclear whether the show will take place or not.
      
    
          If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chatÂ 988lifeline.org.
      
    
          Story developing ...

title: See Photos of Lisa Rinna From Night of Alleged Drugging at 'Traitors' Premiere Party
description:
Lisa Rinna
                          'Traitors' Cast Pic Taken Night of Alleged Drugging
body:
Lisa Rinna
                          'Traitors' Cast Pic Taken Night of Alleged Drugging
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            12:13 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Lisa Rinna was allegedly drugged at "The Traitors" Season 4 premiere party ... and we have photos taken throughout the night prior to her being rushed out of the function.
      
    
          In the group photo, you can see host Alan Cumming with his hand around Lisa's waist as Colton Underwood drapes his arm over her shoulder. She has a bit of a vacant look on her face and it's unclear if she's carrying her weight herself or if her costars are helping to prop her up.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          We're told Colton helped Lisa through a group pic after noticing something wrong with her. It's unclear if this is the exact photo or one of many from the night of January 8.
      

          Sources familiar with the situation told us Colton was with Lisa the whole night, so he knew she didn't have that much to drink ... but she appeared completely inebriated, which prompted him to alert her team.
      
    
          Colton and Lisa were at odds on the show, and their beef continued off-camera as Lisa has made public references to Colton's "stalker past" -- the former "Bachelor" contestant was accused of stalking an ex-girlfriend -- but the bad blood didn't come into play when Lisa really needed help.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          It's unclear if police were involved in this incident or if Lisa went to the hospital.
      
    
          We reached out to Lisaâ€™s reps for comment as well as Colton's ... so far, no word back from either.
